thread.title: Romelu Lukaku's mum urges him to quit Everton? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers
thread.title_full: Romelu Lukaku's mum urges him to quit Everton? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Romelu Lukaku's mum urges him to quit Everton? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers
text:
Sport Romelu Lukaku's mum urges him to quit Everton? Transfer news and gossip from Sunday's papers PLUS: Ryan Sessegnon will snub a move to Liverpool this summer in order to sign a contract extension at Fulham Share Is Romelu Lukaku off this summer? (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Everton are blaming Romeulu Lukaku's mother for his desire to leave the club. 
The Belgian appeared keen to put pen to paper on a new deal at Goodison Park before his recent U-turn. 
Everton's top scorer now looks set to leave this summer and The Times say his mother is to blame. 
But what other transfer lines are there in Sunday's papers? 
Here is our round-up of all the best stories... Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger reveals he will announce future plans "soon" Share this video Watch Next Top stories from the Sunday Mirror 
Arsenal will join the chase for Ross Barkley if the Everton midfielder is put up for sale this summer. The 22-year-old will have a year left on his contract after this season and has stalled on signing a new one, which has alerted the likes of Tottenham and Chelsea to his possible availability. 
Romelu Lukaku will have the final say on his future, under a deal he struck with Everton last summer. In talks with majority shareholder Farhad Moshiri and chairman Bill Kenwright, the Belgium international agreed to stay for one more season, and if Everton failed to qualify for the Champions League in the 2016-17 campaign, the Goodison club would not stand in the 23-year-old’s way. 
Chelsea are preparing a £40million double swoop for Benjamin Mendy and Bernardo Silva, two of the Monaco stars who helped knock Manchester City out of the Champions League last week. Monaco's Bernardo Silva (Photo: AFP) 
Harry Kane will be England’s captain for next year's World Cup finals in Russia — and beyond. Wayne Rooney’s days as a guaranteed starter and skipper for his country are over and new manager Gareth Southgate believes Spurs striker Kane has the qualities to be the Three Lions' leader. Southgate has also identified Liverpool midfielder Adam Lallana, Manchester United defender Chris Smalling and winger Raheem Sterling of Manchester City as candidates to wear the armband 
Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp is trying to land Borussia Dortmund’s Ousmane Dembele this summer. The 19-year-old has been heavily linked with a move to Barcelona, but former Dortmund coach Klopp is refusing to give up hope of luring the striker to his Reds. 
Steven Gerrard will be ready to succeed Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool boss after coming through the Kop kindergarten, says Ian Rush. Anfield legend Rush has backed ex-skipper Gerrard’s decision to turn his back on high-profile offers to learn his trade as a coach and future manager at the Liverpool Academy. He can even see a future 'dynasty' with Gerrard and former teammate Jamie Carragher uniting to lead the Reds. 
While insisting he won’t brazenly encourage his stars to embrace a gamesmanship culture, new England boss Gareth Southgate accepts that, if his Three Lions don’t get streetwise, they’ll just be shooting themselves in the foot. Top stories from the Sunday People Kostas Manolas (Photo: Getty) 
Manchester City keeper Willy Caballero has spoken proudly of his 14-year-old daughter Guillermina's successful battle with a rare form of cancer that it was feared would claim both her eyes. 
Everton star Romelu Lukaku pulled out of contract talks this week over a planned £100million buy-out clause. The Belgium international striker was unhappy with the level of compensation the Toffees wanted for him, in the event of an offer landing on the table at Goodison Park. 
Tottenham are waiting to hear whether Real Madrid are willing to sell midfielder Mateo Kovacic in the summer. The 22-year-old Croatian has struggled for game time with the European champions this season, and while his contract includes a £21million buyout clause, it's believed the Spaniards would consider offers of around £17.5m if they do opt to move him on. Transfer news from other newspapers and websites Ryan Sessegnon (Photo: Rex Features) 
Ryan Sessegnon will snub a move to Liverpool this summer in order to sign a contract extension at Fulham. (Star) 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's agent Mino Raiola says it is extremely unlikely his client will move to Napoli. (Various) 
Tottenham are keen on signing Real Betis striker Antonio Sanabria this summer. (Express) Like us on Facebook
